form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Medical Certification for Disability Exceptions, NARA #1115-0205

full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/18/2023 U.S. Department of Justice OMB # 1115-0205 Immigration and Naturalization Service Medical Certification for Disability Exceptions Part I. THIS SECTION TO BE COMPLETED BY THE APPLICANT (Please print or type information) Last Name First Name Middle Name Social Security Number LEE FONG CHING WAI 611-54-6321 Address Alien Number 612 1/2 N. New High Street Apt #23. A043088228 City State Zip Code Cal 90012 Los Angeles Telephone Number Date of Birth Sex 1-213-687-8518 08-21-14 F I, LEE FONG CHING WAI authorize CHUNG WAI NG, M.D (Applicant's Name) (Licensed medical doctor or licensed clinical psychologist) to release all relevant physical and mental health information related to my medical status to the INS for the purpose C applying for an exception from the English language and U.S. civics testing requirements for naturalization. I certif under penalty of perjury pursuant to Title 28 U.S.C. Section 1746, that the information on the form and any evidenc submitted with it is all true and correct. I am aware that the knowing placement of false information on the Form N-64 and related documents may also subject me to civil penalties under 8 U.S.C. Section 1324c. Signature Date 09/25/98 Part II. THIS SECTION TO BE COMPLETED BY A LICENSED MEDICAL DOCTOR OR LICENSED CLINICA PSYCHOLOGIST (see instructions) The individual named above is applying for an exception from the English language and U. S. history and civics test required of applicants for naturalization. The Immigration and Naturalization Service's regulations require the applicants for an exception based on disability submit this certification form, completed by a licensed medical doctor C licensed clinical psychologist, along with a completed application for naturalization (Form N-400). Please answer the following questions as clearly and completely as possible, using common terminology and complete word and phrases. 1. Date of your most recent examination of the applicant. 8/3 19 97 2. Is this your first examination of the individual? Yes No X If yes, who is the regular attending physician? 3. Based on your examination, describe any findings of a physical or mental disability or impairment which, in you professional medical opinion, would prevent this applicant from demonstrating knowledge of basic English languag and/or U.S. history and civics. Describe in detail. If applicant has a mental disability or impairment, please provid DSM diagnosis. This is an 84-years old female who suffered from the following medical problems: 1. The patient had loss of consciousness and fell down on-the street on 3/4/97. She had a CT scan of the head( this is a X ray study) and showed a stroke. A stroke is a disease caused by blockage of certain branches of arteries in the brain; it can cause permanent demage to the brain.Assa result of the-streke, a person may develop impairment of memory, slurred speech, weakness in the extremities and even paralysis. Assa result of her stroke, this patient has had poor memory, has been unable tocconcentrate, study, learn, read or remember. 2. Blurred visions in both eyes; the patient had cataract surgery in both eyes 4 years ago. 3. Emphysema with chest congestion, shortness of breaths on exertions and walking. 4. High blood pressure. 5. Osteoarthritis with bone and joints pain. As a result of her stroke, this patient has had poor memory, unable to remember, study, learn, or read; she also has had frequent shortness of breath; diffuse bone and joints pain, blurred ***** Continue on the other side *****
